c74object.name: spat5.oper.embedded
c74object.description:
spat5.oper is the main control interface for spat5.spat~.
The core of spat5.oper is a perceptual control module based on research carried out in the Ircam room acoustics team on the objective and perceptual characterization of room acoustic quality.This control interface can be set to imitate the interaction between source(s) and the acoustics of an existing room and it allows to interpolate or extrapolate naturally between different acoustic qualities.
The graphical user-interface in spat5.oper is divided into tabs :
- Source tabs provide controls for the perceptual description of the source's acoustic quality, virtual localization, orientation and directivity,
- Reverb tabs provide controls for the perceptual description of the virtual room's acoustic quality.

attribute.name: embed
attribute.description: The embed attribute allows to store the state of the object within the patcher. The complete state of the object is stored whenever the patcher is saved to disk. Upon loading the patcher or copying the object box, the state is restored.

attribute.name: initwith
attribute.description:
The initwith attribute can be used to specify the initial state of the object. You should provide a list of comma-separated OSC commands. The list of messages should be quoted (with double quote character "). This is similar to sending the list of commands via loadbang or loadmess.
Have a look at the spat5.tuto-osc-3.maxpat example for further details.
Note that the initwith attribute cannot be set via message, attrui or inspector; it must be typed directly within the object box.

attribute.name: internals
attribute.description:
The internals attribute represents the number of internal channels of the artificial reverberator.
Spat uses a Feedback Delay Network (FDN) reverberator engine.
Basically this can be seen as an array of delay lines which are fed back into a mixing matrix. The internals attributes represents the size of the feedback matrix.
Choosing the size of this matrix is a trade-off between CPU consumption and the echo density.
Increasing the size of the matrix will generate a densier reverb tail at the expense of a higher CPU load.
A typical value of 8 is a good compromise between CPU load and natural sounding reverb. A value of 16 may be useful especially when dealing with a very long reverberation time or with very percussive sound (where a smaller FDN might sometimes sounds too poor).
It is recommended not to use a value below 6.

attribute.name: parameter_enable
attribute.description: The parameter_enable attribute is used for compatibility with Max snapshots. It can also be used to store the initial state of the object (see 'Initial Enable' in the Max inspector).

method.name: /source/number
method.description: set the number of sources.
method.digest: set the number of sources

method.name: /room/number
method.description: set the number of rooms.
method.digest: set the number of rooms

method.name: /source/[index]/pres
method.description: set the (source) presence for the i-th source. The "source presence" factor defines the early sound (energy of direct sound and early room effect). A variation of the "source presence" creates a convincing effect of proximity or remoteness of the sound source.

method.name: /source/[index]/warm
method.description: set the warmth for the i-th source. The "source warmth" factor defines the variation of early sound at high frequencies.
method.digest: set the warmth for the i-th source. The "source warmth" factor defines the variation of early sound at high frequencies

method.name: /source/[index]/bril
method.description: set the brillance for the i-th source. The "source brillance" factor defines the variation of early sound at low frequencies.
method.digest: set the brillance for the i-th source. The "source brillance" factor defines the variation of early sound at low frequencies

method.name: /source/[index]/prer
method.description: set the (room) presence for the i-th source. The "room presence" factor defines the energy of later reflections and reverberation (late sound).
method.digest: set the (room) presence for the i-th source. The "room presence" factor defines the energy of later reflections and reverberation (late sound)

method.name: /source/[index]/revp
method.description: set the running reverberance for the i-th source. The "running reverberance" factor defines the early decay time. The term "reverberance" refers to the sensation that sounds are prolonged by the room reverberation. Late reverberance differs from "running reverberance" by the fact that it is essentially perceived during interruptions of the message radiated by the source. Running reverberance, on the contrary, remains perceived during continuous music.

method.name: /source/[index]/env
method.description: set the envelopment for the i-th source. The "envelopment" factor defines the energy of early room effect relative to direct sound.
method.digest: set the envelopment for the i-th source. The "envelopment" factor defines the energy of early room effect relative to direct sound

method.name: /source/[index]/air
method.description: enable air absorption for the i-th source.
method.digest: enable air absorption for the i-th source

method.name: /source/[index]/doppler
method.description: enable doppler effect for the i-th source.
method.digest: enable doppler effect for the i-th source

method.name: /source/[index]/drop
method.description: set the drop factor (in dB) for the i-th source.
method.digest: set the drop factor (in dB) for the i-th source

method.name: /source/[index]/drop/mode
method.description:
set the drop mode for the i-th source.
Possible values: linear, log2.
method.digest: set the drop mode for the i-th source. Possible values: linear, log2

method.name: /source/[index]/radius
method.description:
set the radius (in meters) for the i-th source. The "radius" parameter defines the radius of a virtual sphere surrounding the listener. When a sound source comes closer to the listener, its energy progressively increases. When the source reaches the "radius sphere", its energy no longer increases. It is clipped. The "radius" parameter hence represents the minimum radius under which the sound level is limited. This provides a "safety area" around the listener in order to avoid over-amplified sounds for nearby sources.
The "radius" parameter is also associated to another phenomenon for 3D panning techniques (such as VBAP, 3D-Ambisonic, and binaural or transaural) : When sound sources comes close enough to reach the "radius sphere", they will smoothly slide over the sphere surface (and thus pass over the listener head). This guarantees a smooth sound trajectory for sources that "crosses" the sphere.

method.name: /source/[index]/room/destination
method.description: set the destination room for the i-th source.
method.digest: set the destination room for the i-th source

method.name: /source/[index]/axis/G0
method.description: set the global gain (in dB) for the axis filter of the i-th source.
method.digest: set the global gain (in dB) for the axis filter of the i-th source

method.name: /source/[index]/axis/Gl
method.description: set the gain (in dB) for low frequencies for the axis filter of the i-th source.
method.digest: set the gain (in dB) for low frequencies for the axis filter of the i-th source

method.name: /source/[index]/axis/Gm
method.description: set the gain (in dB) for medium frequencies for the axis filter of the i-th source.
method.digest: set the gain (in dB) for medium frequencies for the axis filter of the i-th source

method.name: /source/[index]/axis/Gh
method.description: set the gain (in dB) for high frequencies for the axis filter of the i-th source.
method.digest: set the gain (in dB) for high frequencies for the axis filter of the i-th source

method.name: /source/[index]/axis/fl
method.description: set the low/med crossover frequency (in Hz) for the axis filter of the i-th source.
method.digest: set the low/med crossover frequency (in Hz) for the axis filter of the i-th source

method.name: /source/[index]/axis/fh
method.description: set the med/high crossover frequency (in Hz) for the axis filter of the i-th source.
method.digest: set the med/high crossover frequency (in Hz) for the axis filter of the i-th source

method.name: /source/[index]/axis/params
method.description: set the filter parameters (G0,Gl,Gm,Gh,fl,fh) for the axis filter of the i-th source.
method.digest: set the filter parameters (G0,Gl,Gm,Gh,fl,fh) for the axis filter of the i-th source

method.description: set the filter parameters (G0,Gl,Gm,Gh,fl) for the axis filter of the i-th source.
method.digest: set the filter parameters (G0,Gl,Gm,Gh,fl) for the axis filter of the i-th source

method.name: /source/[index]/axis/params
method.description: set the filter parameters (G0,Gl,Gm,Gh) for the axis filter of the i-th source.
method.digest: set the filter parameters (G0,Gl,Gm,Gh) for the axis filter of the i-th source

method.description: mute the axis filter of the i-th source.
method.digest: mute the axis filter of the i-th source

method.description: bypass the axis filter of the i-th source.
method.digest: bypass the axis filter of the i-th source

method.name: /source/[index]/axis/reset
method.description: reset the axis filter of the i-th source.
method.digest: reset the axis filter of the i-th source

method.description: set the global gain (in dB) for the omni filter of the i-th source.
method.digest: set the global gain (in dB) for the omni filter of the i-th source

method.name: /source/[index]/omni/Gl
method.description: set the gain (in dB) for low frequencies for the omni filter of the i-th source.
method.digest: set the gain (in dB) for low frequencies for the omni filter of the i-th source

method.description: set the gain (in dB) for medium frequencies for the omni filter of the i-th source.

method.digest: set the gain (in dB) for high frequencies for the omni filter of the i-th source

method.name: /source/[index]/omni/fl
method.description: set the low/med crossover frequency (in Hz) for the omni filter of the i-th source.
method.digest: set the low/med crossover frequency (in Hz) for the omni filter of the i-th source

method.name: /source/[index]/omni/fh
method.description: set the med/high crossover frequency (in Hz) for the omni filter of the i-th source.
method.digest: set the med/high crossover frequency (in Hz) for the omni filter of the i-th source

method.name: /source/[index]/omni/params
method.description: set the filter parameters (G0,Gl,Gm,Gh,fl,fh) for the omni filter of the i-th source.
method.digest: set the filter parameters (G0,Gl,Gm,Gh,fl,fh) for the omni filter of the i-th source

method.name: /source/[index]/omni/params
method.description: set the filter parameters (G0,Gl,Gm,Gh,fl) for the omni filter of the i-th source.
method.digest: set the filter parameters (G0,Gl,Gm,Gh,fl) for the omni filter of the i-th source

method.name: /source/[index]/omni/params
method.description: set the filter parameters (G0,Gl,Gm,Gh) for the omni filter of the i-th source.
method.digest: set the filter parameters (G0,Gl,Gm,Gh) for the omni filter of the i-th source

method.name: /source/[index]/omni/mute
method.description: mute the omni filter of the i-th source.
method.digest: mute the omni filter of the i-th source

method.name: /source/[index]/omni/bypass
method.description: bypass the omni filter of the i-th source.
method.digest: bypass the omni filter of the i-th source

method.name: /source/[index]/omni/reset
method.description: reset the omni filter of the i-th source.
method.digest: reset the omni filter of the i-th source

method.name: /source/[index]/direct/mute
method.description: mute direct sound for the i-th source.
method.digest: mute direct sound

method.name: /source/[index]/early/mute
method.description: mute early for the i-th source.
method.digest: mute early

method.name: /source/[index]/cluster/mute
method.description: mute cluster for the i-th source.
method.digest: mute cluster

method.name: /source/[index]/reverb/mute
method.description: mute late reverb for the i-th source.
method.digest: mute late reverb

method.name: /source/[index]/reset
method.description: reset the i-th source to default values.
method.digest: reset source

method.name: /source/[index]/early/width
method.description: set the early width angle (in deg) for the i-th source. In Spat, early reflections (discrete echoes) are panned as a "stereo pair" spatially surrounding the direct sound. The "early with" parameter specifies the width of this stereo pair.
method.digest: early width angle

method.name: /source/[index]/early/shape
method.description: set the early shape (in %) for the i-th source. The "early shape" parameter characterizes the amplitude distribution of the early echoes. By default, all early reflections (discrete echoes) have the same amplitude. This corresponds to early shape = 50 %. When early shape is less than 50 %, the shortest echoes have a stronger amplitude (and the longest echoes are dimmed). When early shape is greater than 50%, the longest echoes have a stronger amplitude. .

method.name: /source/[index]/panrev
method.description: set the panrev factor (in %) of the i-th source. By default, the late reflections (a.k.a "cluster" in spat dialect) and the late reverb (tail) are fully diffuse (coming from all spatial directions). When you increase the "pan rev" parameter, some of the cluster reflections will be panned (similarly to the early reflections), making the reverberation effect more directional (less diffuse).
method.digest: panrev factor

method.name: /source/[index]/lock
method.description: lock the i-th source.
method.digest: lock the i-th source

method.name: /room/[index]/reverberance
method.description: set the reverberance for the i-th room. The "reverberance" factor defines the mid-frequency decay time. The term "reverberance" refers to the sensation that sounds are prolonged by the room reverberation. Late reverberance differs from "running reverberance" by the fact that it is essentially perceived during interruptions of the message radiated by the source. Running reverberance, on the contrary, remains perceived during continuous music.

method.name: /room/[index]/heaviness
method.description: set the heaviness for the i-th room. The "heaviness" factor defines the relative decay time at low frequencies.
method.digest: set the heaviness for the i-th room. The "heaviness" factor defines the relative decay time at low frequencies

method.name: /room/[index]/liveness
method.description: set the liveness for the i-th room. The "liveness" factor defines the relative decay time at high frequencies.
method.digest: set the liveness for the i-th room. The "liveness" factor defines the relative decay time at high frequencies

method.name: /room/[index]/reverb/roomsize
method.description: set the room size for the i-th room.
method.digest: set the room size for the i-th room

method.name: /room/[index]/early/min
method.description: set the early start (in msec) for the i-th room.
method.digest: set the early start (in msec) for the i-th room

method.name: /room/[index]/early/max
method.description: set the early end (in msec) for the i-th room.
method.digest: set the early end (in msec) for the i-th room

method.name: /room/[index]/early/distr
method.description: set the early distribution for the i-th room.
method.digest: set the early distribution for the i-th room

method.name: /room/[index]/cluster/min
method.description: set the cluster start (in msec) for the i-th room.
method.digest: set the cluster start (in msec) for the i-th room

method.name: /room/[index]/cluster/max
method.description: set the cluster end (in msec) for the i-th room.
method.digest: set the cluster end (in msec) for the i-th room

method.description: set the cluster distribution for the i-th room.
method.digest: set the cluster distribution for the i-th room

method.name: /room/[index]/reverb/min
method.description: set the reverb start (in msec) for the i-th room.
method.digest: set the reverb start (in msec) for the i-th room

method.name: /room/[index]/reverb/density
method.description: set the modal density for the i-th room.
method.digest: set the modal density for the i-th room

method.name: /room/[index]/air
method.description: enable air absorption for the i-th room.
method.digest: enable air absorption for the i-th room

method.description: set air absorption frequency for the i-th room.
method.digest: set air absorption frequency for the i-th room

method.digest: enables infinite reverb for the i-th room

method.description: mute the i-th room.
method.digest: mute the i-th room

method.digest: reset the i-th room to default values

method.description: open a given tab of the interface.
method.digest: open a given tab of the interface

method.name: /internals
method.description: set the number of internal channels for FDN reverb.
method.digest: set the number of internal channels for FDN reverb

method.name: /viewer/visible
method.description: set visibility of the scene viewer.
method.digest: set visibility of the scene viewer

method.name: /source/number
method.description: set the number of sources.

method.description: set the visibility of the i-th source.
